title: California: Can a Memo of Costs... Declaration of Accrued Interest be filed 30 months after the judgment after trial was filed.
question: Plaintiff filed a Memo of Costs...Declaration of Accrued Interest 30 months after the judgment after trial was filed.
answers: Yes. Memorandum of Costs and declaration of Accrued Interest can be filed at this time.
The creditor is entitled to recover interest at the rate o 10% per annum. If you disagree, you must promptly file a motion to tax costs.
